info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 1:32PM EST until January 09 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 245 PM EST. * At 132 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Uptown Charlotte to 4 miles southeast of Rock Hill to 12 miles south of Chester, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Monroe, South Charlotte, Matthews, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, and Waxhaw. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for the Piedmont of North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
